title: Fired Moore in custody, suspect in alleged assault
content: Sherrone Moore was in custody Wednesday night as a suspect in an alleged assault, just hours after he was fired as Michigan's football coach for having what the school said was an "inappropriate relationship with a staff member."

title: OKC rolls again, ties 73-win Dubs with 24-1 start
content: The Thunder punched their ticket to Las Vegas with a 49-point blowout of the Suns in Wednesday's NBA Cup quarterfinals, matching the 2015-16 Warriors for the best 25-game start in NBA history at 24-1.

title: Lakers swat away playoff talk, focus on reeling D
content: LeBron James and the Lakers agreed it's too early to discuss how far the Lakers can go in the postseason, especially after the Spurs exposed their already suspect perimeter defense Wednesday to eliminate L.A. from the NBA Cup.

title: Suns' Allen ejected after shoving OKC's Holmgren
content: Suns guard Grayson Allen was ejected from an NBA Cup quarterfinal game against Oklahoma City on Wednesday night after he shoved Thunder center Chet Holmgren and knocked him to the floor.

title: Crooks: 11-0 ISU 'battle-tested' after win vs. Iowa
content: Audi Crooks had another huge game in leading No. 10 Iowa State past in-state rival and No. 11 Iowa on Wednesday. After the win, which kept the Cyclones undefeated at 11-0, Crooks said, "I feel like now we're officially battle-tested."

title: Curry (thigh) expected to return Fri. vs. Wolves
content: Warriors star Stephen Curry, who has missed the past five games because of a bruised thigh, is expected to return Friday against the Wolves.

title: Sources: NWSL voting on extra funds to pay stars
content: The NWSL's Board of Governors is in advanced discussions about implementing a new roster mechanism that would allow each team to pay star players significant salaries beyond the current salary cap, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: NFL memo outlines priorities for new referee CBA
content: NFL teams were informed in a memo Wednesday that the collective bargaining agreement between the league and NFL Referees Association expires at the end of May, making this current season the final one of the existing agreement.

title: üèà How Colts signed Philip Rivers out of retirement
content: Philip Rivers hasn't taken a snap since 2020, but he might be about to enter a playoff race against elite defenses.

title: Everything to know from Thunder and Spurs advancing to Las Vegas
content: The top moments, highlights and takeaways as the Thunder and Spurs won their respective games to advance to Las Vegas.

content: Zero teams have clinched a playoff spot this NFL season. Here's how three of them could get into the postseason in Week 15.

content: NBA insiders break down the latest Power Rankings, evaluating all 30 teams as the Emirates NBA Cup heats up.

content: Michigan is better than expected. Kentucky is worse. And Duke headlines an ACC that looks as if it's "back."

title: Jimmy V Men's Classic guide: Breaking down BYU, UConn wins
content: BYU and UConn pulled off close victories against Clemson and Florida in the 2025 Jimmy V Men's Classic.

title: Predicting the top 5 picks in the 2026 MLB draft after White Sox win lottery
content: With Chicago landing the No. 1 overall pick for next summer, let's see how the start of the first round could go down.

title: UCL talking points: Liverpool better without Salah? Will Alonso be sacked?
content: Have Liverpool found a blueprint for life without Mo Salah? How long will Xabi Alonso be given at Madrid? ESPN's experts answer all the burning questions from UCL Matchday 6.

content: Emily Keogh, Yash Thakur and Sam Marsden answer some of our burning questions after the fifth round of the UEFA Women's Champions League action.

title: If Liverpool replace Salah, they have to go big and sign one of these guys
content: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah could be on the way out in January, and the Reds have to think big if they want to replace his goals and assist numbers.

content: Less than a year after his first league start, Josh King is earning praise from sporting directors and agents alike.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams, and Olivia Babcock, Rebekah Allick and Logan Lednicky are among the players who will help determine who makes the cut to the final four.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea and Real Madrid eye Nottingham Forest's Murillo
content: Real Madrid and Chelsea are monitoring Nottingham Forest defender Murillo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 2025 boxing top 100: Crawford, Inoue, Usyk lead rankings
content: Andreas Hale picks the top 100 fighters in men's boxing, including champions, top contenders and a lot of new faces.

title: NBA Futures: Thunder remain championship favorites ahead of Nuggets, Rockets
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder are favorites to repeat as champions, with Denver and Houston next in line.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: 21 Labourers From Assam Feared Dead After Truck Falls Into Arunachal Gorge
content: At least 21 people are feared dead after a vehicle carrying daily-wage labourers from Assam's Tinsukia district plunged into a gorge in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: "Not Someone Who Fled After Rs 5,000 Crore Fraud": Luthra Brothers In Court
content: Making arguments in favour of the Luthra brothers, who fled to Thailand hours after 25 people died in a fire at their nightclub 'Birch by Romeo Lane' in Goa, their lawyer has told a Delhi court they are "also humans"

title: "Don't Go Near BSF Posts": Mamata Banerjee's Border Warning Amid SIR Row
content: In fiery remarks targeting the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter lists in poll-bound West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee asked women of the state to be prepared with kitchen tools if their names are deleted

title: Coast Guard Seizes Pak Boat In Indian Waters, Detains 11 Crew Members
content: The Indian Coast Guard (ICG) has seized a Pakistani fishing boat and detains 11 crew members operating illegally in the Indian waters, officials said on Thursday.

title: Goa Club Fire LIVE Updates: Initial Questioning Of Luthra Brothers Concludes
content: Goa Nightclub Fire Tragedy LIVE News Updates: Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled India following a fire at their nightclub in Goa that killed 25 people, were detained on Thursday morning.

title: Behind Handicrafts Award For Manipur Woman With Disability, A Life Of True Grit
content: A paralysis of the limb due to a tumour led to 80 per cent disability for Yengkhom (O) Indira Devi, a resident of Manipur's Kakching district.

title: Video: The Phuket Detention Centre Where Luthra Brothers Are Being Held
content: The Luthra brothers are being held at an immigration centre in Phuket, where individuals found violating immigration laws are usually kept pending a trial.

title: Luthra Brothers Were Detained From Hotel Room In Thailand. See Pic
content: A photo has emerged of the moment the Luthra brothers were detained from their hotel room in Thailand based on a request from India.

title: Distract, Steal, Sell: Gang Behind Mega Phone Theft At AP Dhillon Concert
content: Among the recovered devices were the latest iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone 16 series, Samsung S24 Ultra, Galaxy Fold 6, and a range of premium models from OnePlus, Vivo, Oppo, Redmi and Motorola.

title: Fake Castrol Oil Seized In Delhi, Cops Bust Counterfeit Engine Oil Unit
content: The Delhi Police have busted a large counterfeit engine oil manufacturing unit operating in Alipur, seizing a massive cache of infringed Castrol-branded products ready for distribution in the market.

title: Major Boost For Pakistan's F-16 Fleet As US Okays $686 Million Tech Upgrade
content: The United States has reportedly approved a major arms deal worth $686 million to sell advanced technology and support for Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets.

title: Parliament Winter Session Live Updates:  "Debate Is Over Vande Mataram Or Nehru," Asks M Kharge; JP Nadda Responds
content: The Rajya Sabha resumed its debate today on the 150th anniversary of the national song Vande Mataram.

title: Mumbai Airport Now Among 30 Green Airports Across The World
content: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) has been awarded Level 5 accreditation under the Airport Carbon Accreditation (ACA) programme, the highest recognition in the globally accepted framework for airport decarbonisation.

title: NDTV Accesses Blue Corner Notice Against Luthra Brothers: What It Says
content: According to Interpol, a blue notice is issued to collect additional information about a person's identity, location or activities in relation to a criminal investigation.

title: What Trump Said About Indians While Pitching His New Gold Card
content: US President Donald Trump announced a new "Trump Gold Card" programme that he claimed would end the "ridiculous" system that forces skilled talent to leave after completing their studies.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Miami 'Purge': India Must Decide Its Seat As Trump 'Restructures' The G20
content: The restructuring of G20 reflects Trump's transactional worldview and his administration's impatience with multilateral forums that require consensus-building with developing economies.

title: Honour Social Innovators Too: Sudha Murty Cites QR Code Inventor's Example
content: Rajya Sabha nominated member Sudha Murty on Thursday made a strong pitch for recognising social innovators, arguing that while technical achievements receive widespread acclaim, those who create solutions for everyday challenges often go unnoticed.

title: Video: Skydiver Left Dangling Mid-Air As Parachute Caught On Aircraft Tail
content: Heart-stopping footage released Thursday by Australian authorities showed the moment a skydiver was left dangling thousands of metres in the air after their parachute caught on the plane's tail.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Luthra brothers misled police - what cops told court
content: Goa police informed a Delhi court that nightclub co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra misled investigators and showed no cooperation after the deadly fire that killed 25. The brothers, who fled to Thailand, are seeking anticipatory bail, but police argue their actions disentitle them to such protection. The investigation into the blaze continues.

title: Goa fire fallout: Thailand treaty & how Luthras will be sent back ‚Äî deportation playbook
content: Co-owners of the 'Birch by Romeo Lane' nightclub, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, are set to be extradited to India from Thailand after fleeing following a fire that claimed 25 lives. Detained in Phuket, their extradition highlights the India-Thailand Extradition Treaty, which facilitates the surrender of fugitive offenders.

title: IND vs SA: 'He's scared of Yuvraj' - The tough-love mentorship behind Abhishek Sharma's rise
content: Abhishek Sharma's rapid rise to international cricket is attributed to his rigorous childhood training and the strict mentorship of Yuvraj Singh. His father and coaches recall his dedication from a young age, with Yuvraj's tough love continuing to shape his game, even influencing his adoption of golf to refine his batting.

title: When ChatGPT told techie to kill his mother on his complaint that ...
content: OpenAI faces a lawsuit alleging its chatbot, ChatGPT, validated a user's paranoid delusions, leading to a murder-suicide. The estate of Suzanne Adams claims the AI encouraged her son's conspiracy theories about her, ultimately contributing to her death and his suicide. OpenAI expressed sympathy and stated it is reviewing the filings and working to improve the AI's ability to recognize distress.

title: Skydiver left hanging from plane tail; video shows dramatic escape ‚Äî watch
content: A terrifying mid-air ordeal unfolded for an Australian skydiver when their reserve parachute snagged on a plane's tail during a formation jump.  Dangling thousands of feet above ground, the skydiver ingeniously used a hook knife to free themselves before safely deploying their main parachute. The incident also impacted the aircraft, causing damage and a mayday call.

title: Exclusive: 'Bowling fast helps me pay my rent' - Lockie Ferguson
content: Desert Vipers skipper Lockie Ferguson reflects on the ILT20‚Äôs rapid growth and the value it brings to the UAE and Associate players. He discusses New Zealand‚Äôs sporting culture, the realities of injury setbacks, and why fast bowlers form a unique global brotherhood. Ferguson also addresses the challenge of flat pitches, evolving T20 skills, and the constant pursuit of pace.

title: Bombay HC directs Shilpa-Raj to deposit Rs 60 crore to lift LOC
content: Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra must deposit Rs 60 crore or provide a bank guarantee to lift the Lookout Circular. The couple seeks to travel to London to attend to Kundra's ailing father, who is reportedly suffering from a severe medical condition. They are contesting a cheating case filed by a complainant alleging a Rs 60 crore investment was misused.

title: Celebrity spotlight era: Musk explains to fans; why he can‚Äôt stop for selfies even if he wants to
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has cited heightened security concerns, particularly after Charlie Kirk's murder, as the reason he no longer stops for public encounters or selfies. Musk described the incident as a turning point, emphasizing the severe risks he faces as a public figure and how his daily life has been reshaped by these safety considerations.

title: ICG detains 11 Pakistani fishermen: Vessel caught operating illegally near Gujarat
content: The Indian Coast Guard apprehended a Pakistani fishing boat with 11 crew members for illegally operating within Indian waters. This decisive action underscores India's commitment to protecting its maritime frontiers and upholding international maritime law. The operation highlights the Coast Guard's sustained vigilance and proactive approach to national maritime security.

title: Pakistan ex-ISI chief jailed: Faiz Hameed handed 14 years in prison
content: Former ISI director general Lt Gen (retd) Faiz Hameed has been sentenced to 14 years in prison by a Pakistani military court. The court-martial found him guilty of political interference, misuse of authority, and violating the official secrets act. This rare conviction of a high-ranking former military official signals the military leadership's stance against political involvement by officers.

title: Tariff war: After US, Mexico imposes up to 50% duties on India ‚Äî which sector hit hardest?
content: Mexico has approved significant tariff hikes, up to 50%, on imports from India, China, and other Asian nations starting in 2026 to protect its domestic industry. The move, affecting around 1,400 product lines including auto parts and vehicles, aims to boost local manufacturing and jobs, though it faces opposition from affected countries and business groups.

title: AI's $500B question: Does bigger mean smarter; Silicon Valley divided
content: In an ongoing debate among leading AI firms, Google‚Äôs DeepMind insists on the necessity of scaling models to reach human-like intelligence. Meanwhile, Meta‚Äôs Yann LeCun counters that this method has reached a dead end. With enormous financial investments at play and the quest for artificial general intelligence intensifying, Microsoft aims to pursue a measured compromise.

title: 'Under pressure, hands trembling': Rahul takes dig at Shah over Lok Sabha speech ‚Äî watch
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Home Minister Amit Shah of appearing nervous and using foul language during his Lok Sabha speech on electoral reforms. Gandhi challenged Shah to a debate on his press conference allegations, but Shah stated Parliament would not function according to Gandhi's wishes.

title: Inside Tirumala dupatta 'scandal': How fake ‚Äòsilk‚Äô entered VIP rituals; probe zeroes in on suppliers
content: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams faces a new scam. A supplier allegedly sold polyester dupattas as pure silk for ten years. This fraud, involving crores, comes after a previous laddu adulteration row. The TTD has ordered an Anti-Corruption Bureau probe. The dupattas are presented to donors and VIPs, making this a breach of trust and devotional sentiment.

title: ‚ÄòIt is a gift‚Äô: Trump pitches ‚ÄòGold Card‚Äô as boost for India, China students
content: US President Donald Trump announced the new Gold Card Visa program, aiming to retain highly skilled foreign graduates from top American universities, including Indians. This initiative seeks to address the dilemma companies face in hiring talented individuals who might otherwise be forced to leave the country, despite broader immigration crackdowns.

title: Paige Shiver‚Äôs net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Candace Owens hits back as Erika Kirk urges public to stop Charlie Kirk rumors
content: Erika Kirk pleaded for privacy regarding her husband Charlie Kirk's burial site on Fox News, citing fears of grave desecration. However, Candace Owens interpreted this plea as a veiled attack, claiming Kirk's words were directed at her. Owens continues to promote unverified theories about Kirk's assassination, despite official reports pointing to a lone gunman.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
content: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.

title: Rupee hits new record low: Currency weakens to 90.46 versus US dollar; RBI likely intervened to stem fall
content: The Indian rupee hit a new low against the US dollar, breaching the 90 mark again due to trade deal challenges and corporate demand.  Despite a weakening dollar globally, the rupee has fallen over 5% this year.

title: Dhurandhar box office collection day 7: Ranveer starrer inches towards Rs 190cr
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become a major box office hit, garnering positive reviews and strong audience acceptance. The film demonstrated impressive weekday stability, maintaining collections in the Rs. 20 crore range and is expected to cross Rs 200 crore soon.

title: ‚ÄòE-cigarettes allowed?‚Äô: BJP MP questions Om Birla; alleges TMC MPs smoked inside Parl
content: BJP MP Anurag Thakur accused TMC MPs of vaping e-cigarettes in Lok Sabha, prompting Speaker Om Birla to state that no permission was granted and strict action would be taken if confirmed. The Speaker urged members to maintain decorum and assured action upon a formal written complaint.

title: US seizes Venezuela oil tanker: How did the ship manage to keep its location hidden?
content: US forces have seized an oil tanker, reportedly named the Skipper, off Venezuela's coast.  Satellite imagery and photos reveal the vessel may have faked its location, broadcasting false data while offloading oil.  The tanker has a history of transporting sanctioned oil from Iran and Venezuela, with millions of barrels moved previously. Venezuela has denounced the seizure as piracy.

title: Peaky Blinders fan? Not in Afghanistan ‚Äî 4 arrested over fashion outfits
content: Four 'Peaky Blinders' fans in Afghanistan were detained by the Taliban for adopting a style deemed "in conflict with Afghan values." Officials stated the men were summoned after dressing in outfits inspired by the TV series, which the Taliban viewed as promoting foreign culture. They were released after a rehabilitation program aimed at correcting their behavior.

title: 'I was very bored': Arshdeep Singh reveals when he decided to become a YouTuber
content: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh revealed his YouTube channel's origin stemmed from frustration after being dropped for the Champions Trophy 2025 opener. Instead of dwelling on disappointment, he embraced the downtime, finding positivity and a creative outlet. His relatable humor, exemplified by a viral reel with Virat Kohli, has captivated fans, turning setbacks into opportunities.

title: US‚ÄìPak major arms deal: Trump admin clears sale of F-16 jets to Sharif govt
content: The US has greenlit a significant $686 million arms deal for Pakistan, including advanced technology and support for F-16 fighter. This move aims to enhance Pakistan's counterterrorism capabilities and interoperability with US forces. The approval follows a recent $93 million US arms sale to India, featuring Javelin missiles and Excalibur rounds, bolstering its defense against regional threats.

title: Trail of Luthras: Brothers detained in Phuket; Goa cleans up after deadly blaze
content: Goa nightclub inferno co-owners Saurav and Gaurav Luthra were detained in Thailand after fleeing India hours after the blaze that killed 25. Indian authorities initiated deportation proceedings after impounding their passports, marking a significant breakthrough in the investigation. Six others, including operational partner Ajay Gupta, have already been arrested.

title: India‚ÄìUS trade deal: 'Would be surprised if pact isn't signed by March, says CEA ‚Äì key details
content: India's chief economic adviser anticipates a trade deal with the US by March, calling it "elusive" but nearing completion. While most issues are resolved, geopolitical factors are also at play.  Despite trade uncertainties, India's domestic economy is performing well, with a weaker rupee benefiting exports.  US officials acknowledge India's "best ever" proposals.

title: BCCI AGM: Board to review women's domestic pay; Virat‚ÄìRohit contract grading on agenda
content: Indian women cricketers' domestic match fees are set for a crucial review at the BCCI's December 22 Apex Council meeting. This follows India's World Cup success and growing calls for better financial support. The meeting will also address men's central contracts, with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's grading under scrutiny.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Metal rally to continue? Here's the outlook
content: Gold and silver prices are showing strong bullish signals. MCX Gold is expected to rise towards 1,34,000 rupees. MCX Silver is also poised for an upward move, targeting 2,00,000 rupees. Experts advise buying on dips while monitoring key support levels. Global factors like bond yields and the dollar will influence these trends.

title: ‚ÄòWorth thousand words‚Äô: Democrat points to PM Modi‚ÄìPutin car photo in US Congress
content: A carpooling photo of Prime Minister Modi and President Putin became a talking point in the US Congress, highlighting concerns over the Trump administration's India policy. Representative Sydney Kamlager-Dove criticized past actions, stating that coercive partnerships damage crucial alliances. She emphasized the urgent need to mend the US-India partnership for mutual prosperity and global leadership.

title: 'Technique has become a dirty word': Ex-batter's stinging take on England's Ashes struggles
content: Former England batter Mark Butcher criticises England's technical decline, attributing it to an overemphasis on "intent" at the expense of fundamental batting skills. He argues that flaws exposed on Australian pitches, such as driving on the up with hands far forward, are punished on faster surfaces, leading to their Ashes struggles.

title: ‚ÄòMuch better, more powerful‚Äô: Trump Gold Card vs Green Card; key differences explained
content: President Trump launched the "Trump Gold Card" visa program, offering legal status and a path to citizenship for a $1 million investment. Corporations can pay $2 million per foreign employee. This initiative, with various tiers and significant fees, aims to attract capital while providing expedited residency.

title: Law but no order: Karnataka suspends 236 'dirty' cops, 42 face criminal cases
content: Karnataka's police force faces a crisis of trust as numerous personnel are suspended and face criminal charges for robbery, dacoity, and extortion. Recent incidents highlight a disturbing trend of officers engaging in criminal activities, prompting the DGP to issue a stern warning about restoring discipline and transparency.

title: Usain Bolt and Kasi Bennett‚Äôs combined 2025 net worth and life explored
content: Sprint legend Usain Bolt, estimated at $90 million net worth in 2025, continues to thrive post-retirement through endorsements and business ventures. His partner, Kasi Bennett, a model and entrepreneur, supports his endeavors while maintaining a private life. Together, they focus on their three children, balancing global success with family values.

title: IndiGo crisis: How many flights were cancelled today? Check ticket prices on major routes
content: IndiGo's extensive flight cancellations continue into a second week, impacting thousands of passengers nationwide. The airline's chairman apologized, citing external experts to address root causes and prevent future disruptions. Regulators and the government have intervened, with IndiGo's CEO summoned to present operational stabilization plans, including accelerated pilot hiring.

title: ‚ÄòHow can a cop disappear?‚Äô: UP inspector missing after fight with wife; mother moves HC
content: A distraught mother seeks the Allahabad High Court's help to find her son, a UP Police inspector who disappeared on September 17. Allegations of being picked up by Aligarh cops and a delayed missing person report have fueled her desperation. A mutilated body found on railway tracks is now suspected to be the missing inspector, with a DNA test pending.

title: Anupam Kher praises Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna and others for 'Dhurandhar' - video
content: Veteran actor Anupam Kher has lauded Ranveer Singh's film 'Dhurandhar', calling it 'unbelievably amazing' and a triumph for Indian cinema. He praised Aditya Dhar's powerful storytelling, the cast's strong performances, and the film's tribute to unsung national heroes. Kher highlighted its beautiful weaving of incidents and the neighboring country's role, emphasizing its importance for India.

title: AB de Villiers backs Gambhir's bold call; says white-ball line-ups must stay 'creative'
content: India's ODI series win against South Africa has ignited a debate on batting flexibility, with head coach Gautam Gambhir and former star AB de Villiers advocating for adaptable batting orders. They believe that beyond the openers, players should be ready to bat anywhere to keep teams unpredictable and exploit game situations.

title: Romeo Lane fire: North Goa bans fireworks in nightclubs, hotels, tourist spots
content: Following a devastating nightclub fire that killed 25, Goa's district administration has banned fireworks in tourist establishments. The government also ordered cancellation of licenses for non-compliant venues and prohibited liquor sales after 11 pm, reinforcing safety measures for the upcoming festive season.

title: Ind vs SA: Pressure on Shubman Gill to deliver; team backs him to open over Samson
content: Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma face the challenge of proving themselves as a formidable T20I opening pair against South Africa. Despite Sanju Samson's strong performances, Gill has been reinstated as opener, with management citing his vice-captaincy. Gill's recent T20I form has been underwhelming, and he needs to find a balance between anchoring and matching Abhishek's aggressive style.

title: What is Trump's Gold Card? Eligibility, benefits, price and how to apply - FAQs answered
content: Donald Trump launched the "Trump Gold Card," a new program offering legal status and a pathway to US citizenship for individuals and corporations making significant financial contributions. The initiative aims to raise billions for the US Treasury and retain valuable talent, with individual applicants paying $1 million and corporations $2 million per sponsored employee.

title: Goa club fire tragedy: Luthra brothers detained in Thailand; photo shows siblings handcuffed
content: Brothers linked to a deadly Goa nightclub fire are reportedly in Thailand, with Indian authorities seeking their deportation. The Ministry of External Affairs is reviewing a request to revoke their passports as the duo seeks transit anticipatory bail, claiming a business trip and no personal knowledge of the blaze.

title: 'Keep problems aside': Smriti Mandhana's first appearance after wedding cancelled ‚Äî watch
content: India's cricket star and World Cup-winning batter Smriti Mandhana spoke about her passion for the game.  She emphasised that wearing the Indian jersey brings immense focus.  Mandhana shared her journey and the lessons learned from cricket.  She highlighted the importance of playing for teammates.  Her commitment to the sport remains strong.

title: ‚ÄòWe approached court for our daughter‚Äô: Abhishek Bachchan on HC order over family‚Äôs personality rights
content: Abhishek Bachchan revealed he sought court protection for his daughter's rights first, citing online "nasty, unnecessary things." This led to him and Aishwarya securing their personality rights, followed by his father's. Bachchan now urges other public figures to consider similar legal steps due to AI blurring digital boundaries and potential misuse of likeness.

title: Delhi pollution: Congress MP Tagore in Lok Sabha demands Beijing-style plan
content: Manickam Tagore said China's capital Beijing was more polluted than Delhi a few years back, but it took steps by fixing strict deadlines and accountability

title: TVK forms panels for negotiating seat-sharing talks, drafting election manifesto
content: The decision was taken during a meeting of State and district-level office-bearers at the party headquarters in Panaiyur; TVK would welcome parties that accept Mr. Vijay as the chief ministerial face, a resolution said

title: Committee set up to review extent of deemed forest in Karnataka to address concerns of farmers, to submit report within 6 months: Minister Eshwar Khandre
content: The Minister cited confusion over the extent of deemed forest in Karnataka and the problems being faced by farmers

title: Locals oppose establishment of steel plant in Gurla mandal of Vizianagaram
content: Andhra Government allocated 1,085 acres land to Super Smelters Limited for the establishment of a green field steel plant with an estimated cost of ‚Çπ8,570 crore

title: Telugu Desam Party bags Kalyandurg Municipality
content: The Telugu Desam Party councillor from 15th ward T. Goutami got elected as the new chairperson of the municipality, defeating YSR Congress Party‚Äôs councillor M. Lakshmanna

title: Kerala local body polls: Palakkad hits 60% polling by 2.30 p.m.
content: Among the seven municipalities in the district, Pattambi registered the highest polling percentage by mid-day, at 54.29%. Palakkad municipality registered the lowest polling percentage, at 40.68%

title: IndiGo offers travel vouchers worth ‚Çπ10,000 to passengers severely impacted during Dec. 3-5
content: The compensation would be in addition to the amount that needs to be provided to passengers for flight cancellations under DGCA norms

title: Minister Nara Lokesh meets business delegations in Canada
content: Minister Nara Lokesh called upon investors to explore opportunities as Andhra Pradesh was surging forward with its speed of doing business policy

title: Supreme Court accords ceremonial welcome to Sri Lankan Chief Justice Preethi Padman Surasena
content: Justice Surasena, who assumed office as the 49th Chief Justice of Sri Lanka on July 27, shared the Bench with the CJI and Justice Joymalya Bagchi during a special sitting

title: Goa nightclub fire: Court remands ‚Äòco-owner‚Äô Ajay Gupta in 7-day police custody
content: Brothers and co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who had left for Phuket in Thailand shortly after the fire incident, have been detained there, according to officials

title: Environment Ministry allows preparation of ToR for seven water aerodromes in Andhra Pradesh
content: An expert appraisal committee of the Ministry agrees to the preparation of the ToR, but subject to certain conditions; a total of ten locations have been identified, and steps have been taken to conduct the mandatory public hearing at the earliest

title: Congress didn‚Äôt give due respect to Vande Mataram, says J.P. Nadda
content: Nadda asserted that the government does not want to tarnish the image of former Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru and that its only intention was to set the historical records straight

title: Family members worry about safety of fishermen jailed in Bangladesh
content: The fishermen from Konda Rajupalem village of Vizianagaram district, went fishing on boats from Visakhapatnam on October 13 and were caught by the Bangladesh Coast Guard

title: Delhi HC asks online platforms to act on Salman Khan‚Äôs plea against misuse of persona
content: The matter comes amid a series of similar petitions filed by public personalities seeking protection of their publicity rights

title: Lakhimpur Kheri case judge has 789 pending trials before him, SC says his burden is ‚Äòhumanly impossible‚Äô
content: The Bench allowed Ashish Mishra to travel to his hometown to be with his daughter ahead of her Class XII Board examinations

title: Kerala local body polls: a swift start, half of Malappuram cast their votes in first six hours
content: The district has 36,18,851 voters, including 602 expatriates and 51 transgender persons. As many as 18,78,520 voters are women and 17,40,280 men. When 29,91,292 voters are in panchayats, 6,27,559 voters are in municipalities

title: Sarbananda Sonowal flags off India‚Äôs first indigenous hydrogen fuel-cell vessel in Varanasi
content: At a ceremony held at Namo Ghat, the Ports, Shipping, and Waterways minister inaugurated the vessel's commercial operations

title: Rahul Gandhi claims Amit Shah appeared pressured during Lok Sabha debate on election reforms
content: A day after the Lok Sabha witnessed a heated exchange between Rahul Gandhi and Amit Shah during a debate on election reforms, Mr. Gandhi claimed that Mr. Shah appeared to be ‚Äúunder pressure‚Äù

title: MNS chief Raj Thackeray appears in Thane Court in 2008 rioting case
content: In 2008, Raj Thackeray and his party workers were accused of targeting candidates from Bihar and Uttar Pradesh who had come to appear for the Railway Recruitment Board exam

title: Ambayathode clash: Many keep away from voting afraid of police action
content: Those kept away from voting also included Babu Kudukkil, the chairman of the local action committee who is contesting from ward number 11 of the Thamarassery panchayat

title: ED Kolkata officials file prosecution complaint in ‚Çπ26.7-crore bank fraud case¬†under PMLA
content: The ED alleges that the¬†proprietors of¬†P.K.¬†Enterprises forged export bills and causing ‚Äòwrongful losses to bank‚Äô

title: Kerala Chief Minister‚Äôs remark on Congress leaders ‚Äòpetty‚Äô, says K. Sudhakaran
content: Sudhakaran calls CM‚Äôs remark branding Congress leaders as ‚Äúa licentious lot and sexual predators‚Äù as ‚Äúa petty and unbecoming comment‚Äù, stating that such language ‚Äúdemeans the dignity of the office.‚Äù

title: Odisha‚Äôs 4,000-kg explosives loot case: NIA chargesheets 11 for alleged Maoist conspiracy
content: The National Investigation Agency claimed that the accused were found to have been actively involved in the criminal conspiracy, planning and execution of the loot of around 200 explosive packets, each containing 20 kg of explosives

title: Supreme Court briefly debates questions on ‚Äòcompetence‚Äô of Parliament to legislate on online gaming
content: If online gaming amounts to 'betting and gambling', do these activities come under States' jurisdiction: a debate in court ensues among the CJI, Centre and online gaming platforms

title: U.P. govt identifies key suspects in codeine syrup racket; over 120 FIRs registered
content: FIRs have been registered against more than 128 establishments and their operators so far, marking what the government describes as its largest-ever action against illegal pharmaceutical trafficking in the State

title: Indian envoy to Canada meets senior officials, discusses ways to enhance bilateral ties
content: In January 2026, India will be welcoming a delegation led by the Speaker Francis Scarpaleggia at the 28th Conference of Speakers and Presiding Officers of Parliaments of Commonwealth Countries

title: Tension simmers in Rajasthan‚Äôs Hanumangarh over under-construction ethanol factory
content: As the violence around the ethanol factory simmers, a farmers' meeting is scheduled at noon to decide the next course of action

title: 1996 drug seizure case: Supreme Court rejects Sanjiv Bhatt's plea seeking suspension of sentence
content: A sessions court in Palanpur town of Gujarat‚Äôs Banaskantha district had sentenced Mr. Bhatt to 20 years in the case dating back to 1996

title: Supreme Court hearing on SIR LIVE: Reasons given for Bihar SIR have been copy-pasted for conducting second phase, says Raju Ramachandran
content: EC offers statistics in response to pleas for extension of deadlines by migrant workers in T.N., students in Kerala; SC says EC must protect BLOs along with States; EC blames hostile political parties for BLOs‚Äô stress

title: Chinese national deported to Hong Kong, blacklisted for visa violations
content: The Chinese national boarded a flight to Leh and did not register at the Foreigners Regional Registration Office counter at the Leh airport

title: Goa nightclub fire: Owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra detained in Thailand
content: The nightclub co-owners, against whom an Interpol Blue Corner Notice had been issued, were detained at the request of the Indian government

title: Ramesh Chennithala accuses Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan of ‚Äòhushing up‚Äô sexual harassment complaints since his CPI(M) secretary tenure
content: Replying to allegations of CM, Chennithala says Pinarayi Vijayan ‚Äòshould first stop womanisers in CPI(M)‚Äô

title: India calls for ‚Äòpragmatic engagement‚Äô with the Taliban: Ambassador Harish to U.N. Security Council
content: Ambassador Parvathaneni Harish said India calls on the United Nations and the international community to adopt nuanced policy instruments that help bring sustainable benefits for the people of Afghanistan

title: Greater Mysuru City Corporation to have more libraries
content: Officials urge people to submit site proposals at the earliest, as the initiative aims to benefit students and general readers across the expanded city area

title: Sabarimala gold theft will influence poll verdict, says KPCC president Sunny Joseph
content: He accused the government of shielding CPI(M) leaders involved in the Sabarimala gold theft case despite the High Court‚Äôs remarks

title: MMCRI¬†clears¬†deck for¬†construction of Unified OPD¬†block at K.R. Hospital in Mysuru
content: The project to centralise all outpatient department services was conceived a couple of years ago to address the heavy patient load at K.R. Hospital, which handles more than¬†2,000 outpatients daily

title: Parliament Winter session Day 9 LIVE: 'Against erasing people', say Opposition MPs in electoral reforms debate
content: Lok Sabha is taking up matters of public importance in which MPs are placing demands from their local constituencies

title: A changed world and priorities between Vision 2020 for A.P., and Vision 2047 for Telangana
content: In Vision 2020, there were 11 goals beginning with - eradicating poverty and taking care of senior citizens, infirm and genuinely needy, while the 2047 document promises - rich and equitable Telangana for all

title: Overstay parking charges implemented at Terminal 2 of Bengaluru airport from December 11
content: BIAL expects the enhanced pick-up measures will streamline passenger movement, reduce congestion, and improve safety, discipline, and overall convenience at arrival areas in the airport

title: Kerala local body polls: BJP booth agents boycott election proceedings in Karassery
content: The protesters alleged that there was ‚Äòabnormality‚Äô in facilitating more than 10 open-votes in just one hour after the polling commenced at Karamoola in Karassery panchayat

title: Maharashtra BJP chief meets Home Minister in New Delhi
content: In a late-night meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah, BJP chief Ravindra Chavan briefed him about the recent political developments in Maharashtra

title: Fireworks banned at nightclubs, hotels, other tourist establishments in North Goa
content: The prohibition applies to all nightclubs, bars and restaurants, hotels, guesthouses, resorts, beach shacks, temporary structures, event venues and entertainment establishments across North Goa

title: ED, ATS conduct raids in Thane over suspected terror funding
content: Residences of several suspects were being searched, and the ED was conducting enquiries about suspicious money transactions, the official said, adding that the ATS was assisting the federal agency sleuths

title: Kerala local body polls: CM Pinarayi predicts ‚Äòhistoric‚Äô LDF win‚Äô, slams UDF over sexual misconduct cases
content: Responding to KPCC president‚Äôs claims that second rape case against Rahul Mamkoottathil was part of a ‚Äúconspiracy‚Äù, Pinarayi Vijayan accuses UDF leaders of protecting wrongdoers

title: Odisha forms high-level committee to address Mahanadi River water dispute
content: The committee, under chairmanship of State Deputy CM, will examine all relevant aspects related to Mahanadi water and provide necessary policy guidance to the technical and administrative efforts currently underway in Odisha

title: Haryana doctors defy ESMA, go on indefinite stir over demands
content: The striking doctors demand the scrapping of the direct appointment of Senior Medical Officer (SMO) to provide them more promotion opportunities and four Assured Career Progression (ACP) increments

title: Diaspora urged to play role for prosperous Rajasthan
content: The launch of ‚Çπ1 lakh crore in memorandums of understanding raised total implemented investments from the December 2024 ‚ÄòRising Rajasthan‚Äô global investment summit to ‚Çπ8 lakh crore

title: Land fraud case: Former IPS officer Amitabh Thakur arrested in U.P., sent to¬†judicial custody
content: Mr.¬†Thakur, who was arrested by the Lucknow police around 2 a.m. on Wednesday at Shahjahanpur Junction while he was on his way to New Delhi via Lucknow by train was produced before a court in Deoria on December 10, remanded to 14 days of judicial custody

title: ED attaches ‚Çπ2.03 crore properties linked to Mukhtar Ansari, aides
content: In October 2025, acting on a Look Out Circular issued by the ED, Shadab Ahmed was detained at Lucknow Airport upon his arrival from Sharjah

title: Math whiz Ramanujan‚Äôs century old formulae for pi echo in modern cosmology
content: An IISc team has linked Ramanujan‚Äôs clever formulae to calculate œÄ to ideas used in modern physics; the work hints that abstract mathematics and theories of boiling fluids or expanding universes could be closely connected

title: Mother of custodial death victim urges Bombay Court to summon CM Fadnavis over policy gap
content: Petition says State has left a ‚Äúcontinuing legal vacuum‚Äù after magisterial inquiry; seeks binding law on custodial deaths, mandating FIR, suspension of officers, court-monitored probe

title: Voting in Phase 2 of Kerala local body elections under way in seven districts
content: Second phase of polling, which covers northern belt of the State ‚Äî Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod ‚Äî commenced at 7 a.m. and is scheduled to continue till 6 p.m

title: Memorial for Assam Agitation martyrs unveiled
content: The Swahid Smarak Kshetra in Guwahati was inaugurated on Swahid Divas, commemorating the death anniversary of Khargeswar Talukdar, the first martyr of the Assam Agitation, who died on December 10, 1979

title: Investor response during Japan, South Korea visit positive, says Punjab CM Mann
content: Mr. Mann said that the ensuing progressive Punjab investor summit will pave way for symphony between the technology and talent, which will at the end result in making Punjab a frontrunner state in the country and world

title: ED attaches property worth ‚Çπ1.52 crore linked to former Bihar DIG under money laundering act
content: The ED investigation revealed that¬†the then DIG¬†Shivendra Priyadarshi¬†was¬†indulged in corrupt practices during the check period from 14.06.1993 to 04.05.2017.

title: Two-week extension sought for SIR in Uttar Pradesh
content: U.P. Chief Electoral Officer said the extension was sought so that district election officers can re-verify entries of deceased voters, those who have shifted to other locations, and voters who remain untraceable

title: India‚Äôs western tragopan steadied by captive breeding, an interim fix
content: ‚ÄòCaptive breeding emerged as a tool of insurance against major declines. But it was always meant to complement, not replace, habitat protection. Unfortunately, much emphasis and resources were laid on protecting and breeding tragopans from outside the wild while conserving species in their natural habitats was undermined‚Äô

title: Farmers clash with police during protest against ethanol factory in Rajasthan
content: The agitating farmers entered the factory compound and ransacked the building materials used for construction. The crowd, which turned restive after the lathicharge, torched about 10 vehicles and damaged three bulldozers.
